testcase.name: ATR - Use Case ID 01 - Search for flights - successful scenario
testcase.summary:
Airline Ticket Reservation - SRS

Use Case ID 01 - Customer

Search for flights - Customer searches for the flights on specific dates - successful scenario

Page 10
testcase.preconditions:
ATRS should be a web-based system.

It should be possible to open and use the website on the computers with operating
systems of Microsoft 7, Microsoft 8, Microsoft 10, Mac Os, Linux, Ubuntu.

Oracle Database 12C should be used to store the data about flight details.

Oracle Database 12C should be used to store the data about users.

HTTP protocol should be used as an interface of communication between client and server sides.

Internet connection

Customer exists

Customer should have internet connection and be able to access to the website

 

SETUP: Customer enters airline's website

step.actions: Wait for the system to display flights on given date
step.expectedresults: Flight for given date has been displayed

requirement.title: ​ATRS should have a customer user interface
Customer user interface should have a GUI

testcase.name: ATR - Use Case ID 12 - Sort flights
testcase.summary:
Airline Ticket Reservation - SRS

Use Case ID 12 - Customer

Search for flights - Customer wants to sort flights - successful scenario

Page 10 - 11
testcase.preconditions:
ATRS should be a web-based system.

It should be possible to open and use the website on the computers with operating
systems of Microsoft 7, Microsoft 8, Microsoft 10, Mac Os, Linux, Ubuntu.

Oracle Database 12C should be used to store the data about flight details.

Oracle Database 12C should be used to store the data about users.

HTTP protocol should be used as an interface of communication between client and server sides.

Internet connection

Customer exists

System has displayed the list of available flights based on customer’s query

 

SETUP: Customer enters airline's website

step.actions: Wait for the system to display list of available flights
step.expectedresults: List of available flights appears on the screen

step.actions: Wait for the system to display list of flights sorted by price
step.expectedresults: System displays list of flights sorted by price

step.actions: Sort list of flights by duration of flight
Wait for the system to display list of flights sorted by duration of flight
step.expectedresults: System displays list of flights sorted by duration of flight

requirement.title: ​ATRS should have a customer user interface
Sorting flights by duration of flight
Customer user interface should have a GUI

testcase.name: ATR - Use Case ID 20 - Payment
testcase.summary:
Airline Ticket Reservation - SRS

Use Case ID 20 - Customer

Search for flights - Customer proceeds with the payment of the booked flight - successful scenario

Page 11 - 12
testcase.preconditions:
ATRS should be a web-based system.

It should be possible to open and use the website on the computers with operating
systems of Microsoft 7, Microsoft 8, Microsoft 10, Mac Os, Linux, Ubuntu.

Oracle Database 12C should be used to store the data about flight details.

Oracle Database 12C should be used to store the data about users.

HTTP protocol should be used as an interface of communication between client and server sides.

Internet connection

Customer exists

Customer has selected the available flight and ticket type of his/her choice

 

SETUP: Customer enters airline's website

step.actions: Wait for the system to ask card details
Wait for the system to handle the payment
Wait for the system to send an invoice to customer's email
step.expectedresults: System has been sent an email to a customer's email

requirement.title: ​ATRS should have a customer user interface
Customer user interface should have a GUI

testcase.name: ATR - Use Case ID 25 - Adding new flights - successful scenario
testcase.summary:
Airline Ticket Reservation - SRS

Use Case ID 25 - Administrator

Search for flights - Administrator adds new flights to the system - successful scenario

Page 12 - 13
testcase.preconditions:
ATRS should be a web-based system.

It should be possible to open and use the website on the computers with operating
systems of Microsoft 7, Microsoft 8, Microsoft 10, Mac Os, Linux, Ubuntu.

Oracle Database 12C should be used to store the data about flight details.

Oracle Database 12C should be used to store the data about users.

HTTP protocol should be used as an interface of communication between client and server sides.

Internet connection

Administrator exists

Administrator successfully logs in to the system

 

SETUP: Administrator enters airline's website

step.expectedresults: Logging to the admin panel is successful

step.actions: Add detail about new flights to the system
step.expectedresults: Detail about new flights has been added to the system

step.actions: Submit the addition about new flights to the system
step.expectedresults: The addition about new flights has been submited to th esystem

requirement.title: ​ATRS should have a customer user interface
Customer user interface should have a GUI
